timeline.message: Track original calls during sync session
Add transport tracker for createFile/createDirectory RPCs

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think this needs to be here.
The check in the main sync() method should be enough
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: Wouldn't this ever take a long time to execute?
replies.author: ggezer

replies.bodyText: loadMetadata only ever executes for a single inode. I think in absolute terms it is not a long amount of time, but relative to other RPCs it could be seen as having a higher cost. I just don't think it's necessary to interrupt the loading process once it has started since it's only for one inode
replies.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: Still don't think this is necessary
replies.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText: I can't comment on this part. @gpang you probably have more context?
timeline.author: ZacBlanco
ZacBlanco
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -204,7 +204,8 @@
    * @param loadOnly whether to only load new metadata, rather than update existing metadata
    */
   public InodeSyncStream(LockingScheme rootPath, DefaultFileSystemMaster fsMaster,
-      RpcContext rpcContext, DescendantType descendantType, FileSystemMasterCommonPOptions options,
+      RpcContext rpcContext, DescendantType descendantType,
+      FileSystemMasterCommonPOptions options,

timeline.bodyText: I don't think anything changed here?
timeline.author: ZacBlanco
ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText:
See other comment.
Change to the CreatePathContext class def removed the need for the extra cast
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText:
The list of call trackers should always be small, correct? 1 most of the time?
Are there any cases when we could have more than that?
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText:
Every context has a state-lock tracker. Some has an additional transport level tracker (GrpcCallTracker).
Even for those, it's very unlikely to have more than 1 canceller. However, it's possible so I give out the list here. (We might also wanna add more trackers in the future...)
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.bodyText: Would like to see some test coverage on throwing for cancelled trackers.
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: I can't see a clear way to test cancellation while the rpc is in progress, aka the loop break logic. I'll try adding some validation for the rest.
replies.author: ggezer
ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: I went for a simpler UT and think going beyond that will require an integration test with mocking which is not feasible.
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.bodyText: I think it is strange to have an API called withTracker but the input parameter is not a tracker but a context? Why can't we just use the other implementation only?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: turned out it was a dead method. removed.
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.bodyText: Is the only reason for this, to have a withTracker() call? It seems inconvenient to add the same class as a template class parameter. Instead, can't we just have a setTracker(), that updates the instance, and we just pass in the instance to the rpc call?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: I'm just trying to make service-handler clean by making the API pretty to use.
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.bodyText: This is a good case for the ExpectedException rule since there aren't any assertions afterwards ;)
timeline.author: ZacBlanco
